alert.note: Alert for Elko; White Pine (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 8:03PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Nevada, including the following counties, Elko and White Pine. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 803 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Heavy rain is around or over the Becky Peak Burn scar. - These storms are slow moving and may stay over the same areas for an extended period of time, leading to localized flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southeastern Elko and Northeastern White Pine Counties - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
